weaknesses.recommendation: The placeholder text 'Search by company or industry...' has low contrast against the background. Increase the text color's contrast to meet WCAG AA guidelines.
The search input field should have a corresponding <label> element for better screen reader support, even if it's visually hidden.
The 'Not logged in' text and footer links are small, which can be difficult for users with visual impairments to read. Increase the font size to at least 14px.

recommendations: Increase size contrast between primary and secondary elements
Consider adding more content or reducing spacing
Increase contrast between text and background colors
Adjust text color, size, or background for better readability
Adjust overall brightness for better visual comfort

recommendations.recommendation: Improve visual hierarchy for primary actions
recommendations.details: Make the '+ New Analysis' button more prominent by using a solid background color. This will guide the user to the primary action on the page.
For the 'Frameworks' column, instead of truncating with '+1', consider showing the full list in a tooltip on hover to provide more context without cluttering the UI.
Create a design for when the reports table is empty. This should include a clear message and a call-to-action to encourage users to create their first report.

recommendations.recommendation: Improve visual hierarchy for primary actions
recommendations.details: Make the '+ New Analysis' button more prominent by using a solid background color. This will guide the user to the primary action on the page.
For the 'Frameworks' column, instead of truncating with '+1', consider showing the full list in a tooltip on hover to provide more context without cluttering the UI.
Create a design for when the reports table is empty. This should include a clear message and a call-to-action to encourage users to create their first report.
Instead of 'Guest' and 'Not logged in', use a single, clear 'Log in' or 'Sign up' button to avoid redundancy and make the call to action clearer.

accessibility_issues.recommendation: The placeholder text 'Search by company or industry...' has low contrast against the background. Increase the text color's contrast to meet WCAG AA guidelines.
The search input field should have a corresponding <label> element for better screen reader support, even if it's visually hidden.
The 'Not logged in' text and footer links are small, which can be difficult for users with visual impairments to read. Increase the font size to at least 14px.
The 'three dots' icon for actions should have an 'aria-label' attribute describing its function, for example, 'aria-label="More actions"'.

design_recommendations.recommendation: Improve visual hierarchy for primary actions
design_recommendations.details: Make the '+ New Analysis' button more prominent by using a solid background color. This will guide the user to the primary action on the page.
For the 'Frameworks' column, instead of truncating with '+1', consider showing the full list in a tooltip on hover to provide more context without cluttering the UI.

Instead of 'Guest' and 'Not logged in', use a single, clear 'Log in' or 'Sign up' button to avoid redundancy and make the call to action clearer.

weaknesses: Weak visual hierarchy - elements lack clear size/importance variation
Too much whitespace - may feel empty
Low color contrast - may affect readability
Text readability could be improved
Brightness may be too high or too low
Low contrast: The light gray text on the white background for form labels and descriptions may not meet WCAG AA/AAA contrast ratios.
Small text size: The text in the navigation bar, form labels, and framework list appears to be small, which can be difficult to read for users with visual impairments.

Insufficient touch target size: The checkboxes in the 'Analysis Frameworks' section are small and closely packed, which could be difficult for users with motor impairments to select accurately on a touch screen.
recommendations: Increase size contrast between primary and secondary elements
Consider adding more content or reducing spacing
Increase contrast between text and background colors
Adjust text color, size, or background for better readability
Adjust overall brightness for better visual comfort
Improve contrast: Use a darker color for text to ensure a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text.
Increase font size: Increase the base font size for body text and labels to at least 16px to improve readability.
Increase touch target size: Ensure all interactive elements have a minimum touch target size of 44x44 CSS pixels.
Improve contrast: Use a darker color for text to ensure a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text.
Increase font size: Increase the base font size for body text and labels to at least 16px to improve readability.
Increase touch target size: Ensure all interactive elements have a minimum touch target size of 44x44 CSS pixels.
Improve visual hierarchy: Make the primary call-to-action, 'Run Analysis', more prominent. Use color, size, and placement to guide the user's attention to the most important elements on the page.

Consistent button styling: Use a consistent style for all buttons to create a more cohesive user experience. Primary actions ('Run Analysis') should be visually distinct from secondary actions ('Clear Selection').

ui_components_detected: Navigation bar with links (Dashboard, Analysis, Frameworks, etc.)
Form with input fields: 'Analysis Name', 'Analysis Type', 'Description', 'Source Code URL', 'Primary Programming Language', 'Primary Cloud Provider'
Dropdown/select menus for 'Analysis Type', 'Primary Programming Language', 'Primary Cloud Provider'
accessibility_issues: Low contrast: The light gray text on the white background for form labels and descriptions may not meet WCAG AA/AAA contrast ratios.
Small text size: The text in the navigation bar, form labels, and framework list appears to be small, which can be difficult to read for users with visual impairments.

Insufficient touch target size: The checkboxes in the 'Analysis Frameworks' section are small and closely packed, which could be difficult for users with motor impairments to select accurately on a touch screen.

Missing focus indicators: It's not possible to tell from a static image, but it's a common issue. Ensure all interactive elements (links, buttons, form fields, checkboxes) have a clear and visible focus state when navigated via a keyboard.
Potentially unclear link purpose: The 'Clear Selection' button's purpose is clear, but its styling as a link might be confusing for some users.
design_recommendations: Improve contrast: Use a darker color for text to ensure a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text.
Increase font size: Increase the base font size for body text and labels to at least 16px to improve readability.
Increase touch target size: Ensure all interactive elements have a minimum touch target size of 44x44 CSS pixels.
Improve visual hierarchy: Make the primary call-to-action, 'Run Analysis', more prominent. Use color, size, and placement to guide the user's attention to the most important elements on the page.

Consistent button styling: Use a consistent style for all buttons to create a more cohesive user experience. Primary actions ('Run Analysis') should be visually distinct from secondary actions ('Clear Selection').
Better form layout: Consider a two-column layout for the form to make better use of the available space and reduce the need for vertical scrolling.
Group related elements: Use visual cues like background colors or borders to group related elements, such as the 'Analysis Frameworks' section, to improve scannability.
Provide helper text: Add helper text or tooltips to explain the purpose of less obvious form fields, like the 'Select Preset' dropdown.

weaknesses.details: The gray text used for the table body content and the 'Showing 1 to 1 of 1 entries' text appears to have insufficient contrast against the white background, which can be difficult for users with visual impairments to read.
weaknesses.recommendation: Use a darker shade of gray for the text to meet WCAG AA contrast ratio guidelines (at least 4.5:1 for normal text).

weaknesses.details: The text within the data table and the pagination information is small, which can be challenging for users with low vision to read.
weaknesses.recommendation: Increase the base font size for the table content and supplementary text to at least 16px.

weaknesses.details: The 'New' button is generic. Users might not know what will be created without clicking it first.
weaknesses.recommendation: Provide a more descriptive label for the button, such as 'New Analysis' or 'New Report', depending on the primary action. If it has multiple options, consider making the most common one the default.

recommendations: Increase size contrast between primary and secondary elements
Consider adding more content or reducing spacing
Increase contrast between text and background colors
Adjust text color, size, or background for better readability
Adjust overall brightness for better visual comfort
Consider standard screen aspect ratios (16:9, 16:10)

recommendations.details: The data table is dense. The rows are very close to each other, making it hard to scan.
recommendations.action: Increase the vertical padding within table cells and consider using zebra-striping (alternating background colors for rows) to improve scannability and separate rows visually.

recommendations.details: The primary action button ('New') is visually similar to the navigation links. It doesn't stand out as the main action on the page.
recommendations.action: Use a stronger, contrasting color for the primary 'New' button to draw the user's attention to it as the key call-to-action on the dashboard.

recommendations.details: The 'Delete' action in the table is a destructive action that can lead to data loss if clicked accidentally.
recommendations.action: Implement a confirmation modal/dialog (e.g., 'Are you sure you want to delete this item?') that appears when a user clicks 'Delete'. This provides a safety net and prevents accidental deletions.

recommendations.action: Implement a confirmation modal/dialog (e.g., 'Are you sure you want to delete this item?') that appears when a user clicks 'Delete'. This provides a safety net and prevents accidental deletions.

recommendations.recommendation: Provide More Context in the Dashboard
recommendations.details: The dashboard currently only shows a table of recent items. It could provide a more valuable overview of the system's status.
recommendations.action: Consider adding summary statistics or data visualizations (e.g., charts, graphs) at the top of the dashboard to give users a quick overview of key metrics before they dive into the table details.

weaknesses.issue: The light gray text on the white background in the 'Recent Analyses' and 'Helpful Tips' sections may not have sufficient contrast for users with visual impairments. For example, the 'Your most recent analysis requests' and 'No recent analyses yet' text has low contrast.
While the form fields have labels, the optional fields are only indicated by placeholder text. It would be more accessible to have a clear '(optional)' text next to the label.
It is not possible to determine from a static image, but it's important to ensure that all interactive elements have a clear and visible focus indicator when navigating with a keyboard.

recommendations.recommendation: The main content area is very wide, which can make it difficult to read. Consider constraining the width of the main content to a maximum of 1200px to improve readability.

The 'Recent Analyses' and 'Helpful Tips' sections on the right side could be more visually distinct. Using a slightly different background color or a border could help separate them from the main form.
For the 'Business Frameworks' selection, consider adding a 'Select All' option to make it easier for users to choose all available frameworks.
The main content area is very wide, which can make it difficult to read. Consider constraining the width of the main content to a maximum of 1200px to improve readability.

The 'Recent Analyses' and 'Helpful Tips' sections on the right side could be more visually distinct. Using a slightly different background color or a border could help separate them from the main form.
For the 'Business Frameworks' selection, consider adding a 'Select All' option to make it easier for users to choose all available frameworks.
The 'Analysis Depth' options are clear, but the estimated time could be more prominent. Consider making the time estimate a larger font size or a different color to draw more attention to it.

When a user clicks 'Generate Analysis', provide immediate feedback that the analysis is being processed. A loading spinner or a progress bar would be helpful, especially for the 'Deep Analysis' which takes longer.

While the form fields have labels, the optional fields are only indicated by placeholder text. It would be more accessible to have a clear '(optional)' text next to the label.
It is not possible to determine from a static image, but it's important to ensure that all interactive elements have a clear and visible focus indicator when navigating with a keyboard.
It is not possible to determine from a static image, but all icons and images should have appropriate alternative text for screen readers.

For the 'Business Frameworks' selection, consider adding a 'Select All' option to make it easier for users to choose all available frameworks.
The 'Analysis Depth' options are clear, but the estimated time could be more prominent. Consider making the time estimate a larger font size or a different color to draw more attention to it.

When a user clicks 'Generate Analysis', provide immediate feedback that the analysis is being processed. A loading spinner or a progress bar would be helpful, especially for the 'Deep Analysis' which takes longer.

The text in the 'Recent Activity' table and the labels on the chart axes are small, which may be difficult to read for users with visual impairments.

Make the primary action button, 'Run Analysis', visually distinct from the secondary actions ('Save as Draft', 'Cancel') by using a solid background color for the primary button and ghost or outline styles for the others.

Group related form elements using fieldsets and legends. For example, the 'Analysis Name' and 'Analysis Description' could be in one group, and the 'Analysis Type' in another. This would improve the overall organization of the form.

weaknesses: Weak visual hierarchy - elements lack clear size/importance variation
Too much whitespace - may feel empty
Low color contrast - may affect readability
Text readability could be improved
Brightness may be too high or too low

weaknesses.details: The placeholder text in the dropdown menus ('Select a Framework', 'Select a Persona', 'Select a Company') has low contrast against the dark background, making it difficult to read for users with visual impairments.
The text input and dropdown menus use placeholder text instead of proper <label> elements. This can cause issues for screen reader users who may not get the context of the form field.
The selected radio button ('RAG') is primarily indicated by a change in color. Relying on color alone to convey information can be problematic for users with color blindness.

recommendations: Increase size contrast between primary and secondary elements
Consider adding more content or reducing spacing
Increase contrast between text and background colors
Adjust text color, size, or background for better readability
Adjust overall brightness for better visual comfort
Consider standard screen aspect ratios (16:9, 16:10)

recommendations.details: Increase the contrast ratio for placeholder text and all other UI elements to meet WCAG AA guidelines (at least 4.5:1 for normal text).
Implement explicit <label> elements for all form fields. For a cleaner look, you can use floating labels that move out of the way when the user starts typing.
Add a more distinct visual indicator for the selected radio button, such as a more prominent border or a checkmark icon, to supplement the color change.
Increase the contrast ratio for placeholder text and all other UI elements to meet WCAG AA guidelines (at least 4.5:1 for normal text).
Implement explicit <label> elements for all form fields. For a cleaner look, you can use floating labels that move out of the way when the user starts typing.
Add a more distinct visual indicator for the selected radio button, such as a more prominent border or a checkmark icon, to supplement the color change.
Ensure all form labels and text have a consistent and readable font size.
The 'View Results' button should be disabled or visually de-emphasized until an analysis is complete to guide the user's workflow and prevent confusion.

accessibility_issues.details: The placeholder text in the dropdown menus ('Select a Framework', 'Select a Persona', 'Select a Company') has low contrast against the dark background, making it difficult to read for users with visual impairments.
The text input and dropdown menus use placeholder text instead of proper <label> elements. This can cause issues for screen reader users who may not get the context of the form field.
The selected radio button ('RAG') is primarily indicated by a change in color. Relying on color alone to convey information can be problematic for users with color blindness.
The labels for the radio buttons ('RAG', 'Autonomous') appear smaller than the surrounding text, which could be difficult for some users to read.

design_recommendations.details: Increase the contrast ratio for placeholder text and all other UI elements to meet WCAG AA guidelines (at least 4.5:1 for normal text).
Implement explicit <label> elements for all form fields. For a cleaner look, you can use floating labels that move out of the way when the user starts typing.
Add a more distinct visual indicator for the selected radio button, such as a more prominent border or a checkmark icon, to supplement the color change.
Ensure all form labels and text have a consistent and readable font size.
The 'View Results' button should be disabled or visually de-emphasized until an analysis is complete to guide the user's workflow and prevent confusion.
Visually group the 'RAG' and 'Autonomous' radio buttons using a <fieldset> with a <legend> to improve the form's structure and provide better context for screen reader users.

weaknesses: Weak visual hierarchy - elements lack clear size/importance variation
Too much whitespace - may feel empty
Low color contrast - may affect readability
Text readability could be improved
Brightness may be too high or too low

weaknesses.issue: The light gray placeholder text inside the input fields may have insufficient contrast against the white background, making it difficult for users with low vision to read. All text should meet WCAG AA contrast ratios.
weaknesses.recommendation: Increase the contrast of the placeholder text or, preferably, rely on the labels above the fields which are clearly visible.

weaknesses.issue: The form does not show how errors would be displayed. If errors are only indicated by color (e.g., a red border), this will not be accessible to users who are colorblind.
weaknesses.recommendation: When displaying validation errors, use both color and text/icons to indicate the issue. For example, a red border combined with an error message below the input field.

weaknesses.issue: It is not possible to determine from a static image if there is a clear and visible focus indicator for keyboard navigation.
weaknesses.recommendation: Ensure that when a user navigates the form using a keyboard, the currently focused element (input, button, link) has a highly visible outline or highlight.

recommendations: Increase size contrast between primary and secondary elements
Consider adding more content or reducing spacing
Increase contrast between text and background colors
Adjust text color, size, or background for better readability
Adjust overall brightness for better visual comfort

recommendations.recommendation: Add a 'show/hide' password toggle icon within the password fields. This allows users to check their input for typos, which is a common source of frustration and login failure.
Implement a real-time password strength meter as the user types. This provides immediate feedback and encourages the creation of stronger passwords.

Upon clicking the 'Create Account' button, disable the button and provide a visual loading indicator (e.g., a spinner) to give the user feedback that their request is being processed and prevent duplicate submissions.
Add a 'show/hide' password toggle icon within the password fields. This allows users to check their input for typos, which is a common source of frustration and login failure.
Implement a real-time password strength meter as the user types. This provides immediate feedback and encourages the creation of stronger passwords.

Upon clicking the 'Create Account' button, disable the button and provide a visual loading indicator (e.g., a spinner) to give the user feedback that their request is being processed and prevent duplicate submissions.

Implement inline validation. As a user moves from one field to the next, validate the input they just provided (e.g., check if the email has a valid format). This provides faster feedback than waiting for a full form submission.
Consider offering social login/registration options (e.g., 'Sign up with Google', 'Sign up with GitHub'). This can significantly reduce the friction of creating a new account.
